Carnage

Carnage is a claustrophobic comedy from veteran film maker Roman Polanski, with the best vomiting scene of the year so far.

The 2012 Baftas: A bit boring?

The glitz, glamour and faint ridiculousness of the Golden Globes were replaced by dignified British decorum, which, in truth, made for a rather flat and predictable affair.

The Woman in Black

By James Bithell

The Woman In Black is anything but faded, injecting class and energy into a genre that has recently become a tad tacky.

J Edgar

The viewer leaves the film without any new or profound understanding of a man in the middle of the USA's most transformative years.

The Descendants

The Descendants is a perfectly enjoyable comedy drama, but one that has had its rough edges smoothed out.

The Artist

The plot centres on Hollywood filmmaking, opening with a movie inside a movie

Sound Mixing

Awards season focuses on the beautiful over the people behind the scenes of the industry
